captions.text:
I know what cats
want, cats want.
Cats want meat.

Come on, yo, let's
get cat-ified.
Woo.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
Let's talk about free feeding.
Come on now, people.

To feed all the time or not,
the concept of free feeding.

Free feeding means leaving
food out for your cats 24/7.

It also means doling
out treats 24/7 as well.

I want to break this
down into two places.

The first thing is
physical, and the other one

is psychologically
slash behaviorally.

Free feeding undermines
the work that we try to do.

Physically, we are playing into
better health with these guys
by not free feeding them.

They are built to
eat small meals
through the course of a day.

I'd say every five to
six hours is optimum.

You push it a little
bit, that's fine.
Cats are not grazers by nature.

Cats are not built
to just eat whenever.
They are built to do what?
Hunt, catch, kill, and eat food.

Food is available to them after
they do a certain activity.

If it's always there 24/7, it
messes with the raw cat brain.

You're experiencing behavior
problems in your house.

You're asking me to
break it down for you.
What's going on in my house?

One of the first places I'll
tell you to look is food.

Think about it if your
cat has litter box issues,

peeing or pooping
outside the box.

If you control when they eat,
you have a fighting chance

to figure out when they're
going to go to the litter box

and then helping them
get to the litter box.
So there's that as well.

You got to remember, folks, cats
are not programmed like dogs.

Cats do not give a
rip about pleasing us.

So if a cat doesn't
care about pleasing us,

we have to start
addressing something

they do want in order
to get what we want.
Yes.

Living with cats is
embracing compromise.

There are so many things
that we can accomplish,
but only if we're feeding meals.

We can achieve
incredible things.

Your homework, should
you choose to accept it,

get your cats off the
free feeding bandwagon.

Put them on the
meal time bandwagon

because I got to
tell you, if you've

got any other
questions-- Jackson,

I've got a cat
who dot, dot, dot.

I want to get my cat
to dot, dot, dot.
It starts with that.
I want to see your comments.

I want to see you
guys subscribe.

I want to keep growing
this thing, man.

Facebook wise, what are
we, like, half a million
strong at this point?

And we want to see
pictures, and we

want to see videos and
stories about your cats.

This is what makes the
cat-ification nation.
So people, get on board.
Don't forget.

Wednesday, March 26 four o'clock
PM on the west coast, seven

o'clock PM on the east
coast and wherever

else you are in the world,
live from the cat cave,
it is a Google Hangout.
I'll answer your questions.

We'll talk about all
kinds of fun stuff.

I've got a new
co-host that I can't
wait to introduce to you guys.
And it will be fun.
Take my word for it.

Find out more information by
following this link down here
below.
Go to my website, YouTube page.
You'll find out more info.

Don't forget, we are also giving
away some fun stuff as well.

But you got to be
live to get the prize,

and you got to be live
to ask your questions.
And you get my drift, right?
So I want to see you there.

The season premiere
of "My Cat From Hell"
on April 26, Saturday.

Please set your
sun dials for that.
It'll be a lot of fun.

This season we're in Boston,
Austin, San Diego, LA.

Bang, it's been a
lot of fun, man.

And I want to share
that with you guys.
So don't forget.
Leave your comments.
Leave your questions.

And join me on March 26
for live from the cat cave.

Until then, folks, for Oliver,
my friend the feral over there,
and me, all light, all love.
Mmm, mojo to you.
Love you, guys.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

title: You're Feeding Your Cat All Wrong!

comments.text:
Dont buy any cat food for your cats its expensive for the supposedly good 
stuff get real fish and meat﻿
comments.author: Payton Cassella

comments.text:
My cat gets a certain amount of food depending on the type and his weight 
twice a day.﻿

comments.text:
Question so what happens when your cat asks for food? They have not hunted 
for it. But they want it. So what then? FYI I don't have a cat but I'm

comments.text:
hahaha My cat would flip out, she has no issues with free feeding. She's

My cat won't be purring when she sees that her food bowl isn't anywhere

comments.text:
Help! My cats craping in my neighbours yard and getting too wild!!! He 
almost got killed driving another cat out of his territory. PLEASE HELP!!!﻿

comments.text:

what if i leave my kitten alone at home when i'm at school ? should i leave 
a big bowl of food in the morning? or a bit and come back from school to 
feed it. (7:30-3:40)﻿
comments.author: Juan Cervantes

comments.text:
1 cat eats wet food (not free feeding), 1 cat eats dry food (free 
feed)...it works very well for us.....but they are cats...ya never know! So 
I will take this advice to heart bc I love your advice.﻿
comments.author: Beverly Bryan

comments.text: i am sorry, i am not getting up at 5 AM just to feed them. they're fine.﻿
comments.author: Valerie Sheppard

comments.text:
I'm unsure if Mr. Galaxy meant to imply that dogs view themselves as 
servants/slaves. Maybe? Dogs are pack animals and in a healthy human/k9 
relationship they regard you as the Alpha. Dogs obey commands because 
you're the pack leader and they know you are keeping the pack alive. They 
'fall in' to their Beta role, like a military unit. Dogs do have a 
different psychology, and that Pack Mentality as at the core of it. They 
may not understand why they have to run around the poles at a Dog Show, but 
they do it because their Alpha tells them to -- and for the yummy treats, 
just like cats at a show. They are animals, after all. ;)﻿
comments.author: Blahblah

comments.text:
My cat is an outdoor cat, so it's irregular when it does come inside and 
have a meal. So we always have the food out for him. I know it's not 
healthy, but what else can I do to make sure my cat gets it's meal?﻿
comments.author: MafiaArne

comments.text:
I have two cats and two food pots but they use both I don't have a warning 
that they use there own my two cats are named sunshine skinny cat and blue 
fat cat ya blue is black so his always camulfushed in the dark now people 
can trip on him sunshine is yellow﻿
comments.author: tails doll td

comments.text:
Thought just dogs go crazy - but beside some good advises (which i really 
appreciate) I never had such probs with my cats ... that's maybe because 
they can go outside when ever they want. >_>'  
^^ but i think this idea of explaining cat behavior is a great way. In 
Germany you still have two sides. One which think of cats as babies and the 
other which think of them as workers - to get rid of mice and other small 
animals.﻿
comments.author: Kerim Neburg

comments.text:
My cat is not even motivated by food. He is motivated by play and 
interaction with me. If I just threw treats down for him, he'd walk away 
and bug me with playtime lol So I do free feed because he doesn't overdo 
it. Although we do play a ton, so maybe a bored ass cat would go to 
eating.. Play with you cat!!﻿
comments.author: Kelly Horvat

comments.text:
Cool. But with my experience I'm going to have to disagree. We used to feed 
my cat on a schedule and she would throw up all the time because she would 
eat the food so fast. I think in her head for whatever reason when we would 
feed her, that was going to be her last meal ever so she had to get it all 
down as fast as she could. I even tested her and fed her a half hour after 
her scheduled feeding and she ate all of that up too. So we switched to 
free feeding and she no longer guzzles the food down or vomits because she 
eats to fast. She knows the food is always there and so she only eats when 
she's hungry. Took her to the vet for an unrelated issue and the vet said 
she was extremely healthy. There are no behavioral problems at all. So i 
really think it depends on the cat, the environment and the situation. I 
don't think it's right to tell someone they're worrying if they're free 
feeding. Instead you should encourage different methods and stick to what 
works for your baby. ﻿
comments.author: HysteriCool

comments.text:
The last time that I tried to limit food through out the day and or night, 
one got violent with me. She felt that I was deprieving her and she almost 
slashed  my throat, now what? mae﻿
comments.author: Mae Ann Nix

comments.text:
That's a great idea :) I've recently been doing this with my dog. I would 
have it exercise and workout a little before feeding him.﻿
comments.author: Abram Ke

comments.text:
I wake up at 6am and go to bed at 10pm.  I usually get home at 5:30pm- what 
are the best times to feed my cats?  I feed them dry food and then once a 
day mix it with wet food.  The dry food they won't eat- they just graze- 
that's why I've been leaving it out.  I'm worried they won't eat.  
Especially my smaller cat. Thanks!﻿
comments.author: El Forero

comments.text:
+El Forero Feed them when you get up, cats rise with the sun so that's 
normally when they hunt. After they eat put the food away until evening 
when you get home. Be sure to set time for play before or between meals.
comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
I'm worried about my tabby cat Picasso's weight gain since I started 
working full time, so I've decided to get rid of free-feeding him and his 
brother Shadow, keeping my fingers crossed and hoping for the best! ﻿
comments.author: Vitti Dubbs

comments.text: +Vitti Dubbs Good luck. :)
comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
I originally only had 1 cat he is a Siberian. I had him since he was 
kitten. I would feed him about 3 times a day can food. I made sure he got 
wet food b/c I heard that otherwise they are more likely to get UTI and 
kidney issues. Then I adopted another cat the problem is my original cat is 
very docile and got used to not eating all his food at once. Now the other 
cat eats his share and then comes over and pushes out my original cat so he 
doesn't get enough food. My original cat is not fat and in fact is 
underweight for a Siberian and the new cat is not obese but on the border 
of overweight. How do I make sure both cats get enough food and not too 
much?﻿
comments.author: Lauren Benton

comments.text:
When I got my cat she was overweight. So I put her on a feeding schedule 
and stopped treats all together. She gets tuna as treat once in a while. 
Well now feeding time is a pain but she dropped most of the extra weight 
she had so I know its better for her. ﻿
comments.author: Raja the mother of the sheeps

comments.text:
only problem is nobody is home 24/7. during the week I have school and my 
mom has work. and on the weekend my moms boyfriend would freak out if we 
didn't go over to his house....how does one work around that?﻿
comments.author: darklady3

comments.text:
Got 3 cats that have been free fed all their lives while some friends have 
fat, sick cats that are not. Mine are 16, 11 and almost 1 - none are fat or 
problematic. Just letting you know.﻿
comments.author: Jellybean Frandsen

comments.text:
I have an 8mo old male kitten. I don't refill his dry until bed time, we 
keep him shut in the living room while we sleep because he's still young 
and energetic and wont leave us be (the bedroom door is easily opened by 
cat) and also gets himself into trouble (he got stuck in the sink once and 
meowed for us to pick him up and get him out). Is it still free feeding if 
I dont refill it at all during the day, but give him wet meals 2x a day? I 
only refill the bowl if it is empty. He has a certain amount of dry food- 
if he eats it, fine, if not, fine. I dont understand if it is still free 
feeding if it's more like leaving a given meal out for him to nosh on 
slowly rather than all at one time. Wet food I throw out if he doesn't eat 
it within about an hour or so, because it dries out and gets icky.﻿
comments.author: Emily Thomas

comments.text:
+Emily Thomas you should play with your cats more often. that way they can 
bite the toy instead of you :D
comments.author: darklady3

comments.text:
Maybe worth noting- I found the little guy abandoned outside. No health 
issues when we found him, not even fleas! Just skinny, so we had a specific 
diet from the vet for the first few weeks just to get him to a healthy 
weight. Now he's 100% fine and no behavioral issues aside from 
play-aggressive biting and affectionate biting which we are working on.
comments.author: Emily Thomas

comments.text: my cat is pregnant can I free feed her?﻿
comments.author: sadeys video

comments.text:
everybody is free fed here... since 20 years... and never an obese 
animal... (that is even this way, I was able to bring a stray adopted cat, 
back to a normal weight)
even the dogs are free fed, and the animals have self regulation, and are 
not stressed over the food and do not have any guarding ressources issues 
this way...
Cats cannot stay without eating for a long time, they need to eat every 3-5 
hours or so, or they may get health problems (liver disorders by example)...
as for the dogs, giving several meals or free feeding, with self regulated 
animals, avoids problems such as stomach twist...﻿
comments.author: Pecky ShiFrit

comments.text:
Hi Jackson, I free feed my cat but she doesn't have a weight issue nor 
behavior issue. I guess my question is, why would I change from free 
feeding to schedule?﻿
comments.author: almightyyoua

comments.text:
My cat chews through everything from phone chargers to shoes. My parents 
want to get rid of him. I need help!!!﻿

comments.text:
Mackenzie breaux



Simba and autumn have been together for a few months I don't remember when 
my mom got him I think it was last year. When she got him almost in he

comments.text:
any advice i would feed my cat meat but every time i feed her anything 
different from her normal food she will break out when she was little it 
was really bad﻿
comments.author: Trinity Rawnsley

comments.text:
I usually feed my cat when ever he asks for it. Usually with a light nip 
though sometimes he'll do it when the food bowl is already full so yeah﻿
comments.author: gunmunz

comments.text:
Jackson I love you,you've helped me so much with your tips on making my cat

comments.author: vicki roberson

comments.text:
I get it - Totally makes sense! Here's the problem: HOW in the WORLD do I 
introduce this 'new concept' to my two 9 & 10yr old babies?? lol I think 
they'd have a nervous breakdown if they went into the kitchen & their dry 
food (all natural) wasn't there waiting for them. They are also fed all 
natural wet food w/either salmon, chicken or beef 2x daily (first thing in 
the morning & 6:00pm on the DOT!) And BeLiEvE me, they CAN tell time :-o  
Ugh, they have me trained SO WELL lol.
What you said sounds like what I need to do but 'HOW' is the question?!
P.S. Did I mention I have a cat that SNORES? Does anyone else have one of 
these? :) She literally wakes ME up out of a dead-sleep bc she's snoring SO 
LOUD. Lord Help Me PLEASE lol
Thanks for any suggestions.     ~Peace﻿
comments.author: vsav331

comments.text:
+vsav331 Why don't you ease them off the dry food? Just leave out a little 
less every other day or so, until they no longer feel the need to be free 
fed so much. Eventually, you will ease it off to zero amount of free 
feeding and be only feeding them your regular morning and evening wet food 
feeding times
comments.author: MrOnairos

comments.text:
My cat snores too. and what makes it worse is that he sleeps on my pillow 
next to my head, so it's right in my ear.
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text: My cat doesn't like wet food﻿

comments.text: my cat doesn't either
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text:
What times throughout the day should I give food to the cats? My mom always 
leaves food out in a bowl (puts more when it's empty) and my cat just eats 
whenever. I want to put my cat on a diet because he's getting overweight. 
Thank you!﻿

comments.text:
Yes, I was planning on that! I keep all stray pieces of yarn in a

comments.text:
What a spoiled little darling. lol Be sure to keep the yarn out of her

comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
Thank you! She is a delight. I crochet and I am having a ball making her

comments.author: Tanya Merkel

comments.text:
+Tanya Merkel Congrats on your new furry family member. You'll have a

comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
+WhiteKoneko  Thank you! I have a new, young kitty who is still young 
enough to stop free feeding. So, I started this AM with vigorous play time 
and then I fed her. I was wondering how often to feed her in this manner 
and you answered my question! Thanks again!
comments.author: Tanya Merkel

comments.text: +Bethany Figueroa No worries. :)
comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
+WhiteKoneko - makes sense to me now, my cat (who we leave food out all the 
time for) eats mostly in the morning and evening at the same time we sit to 
eat. Thanks!
comments.author: Bethany Figueroa

comments.text: +NintendodogsDream No worries. Good luck.
comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text: Ah I see! This helps a lot, thanks!
comments.author: NintendodogsDream

comments.text:
+NintendodogsDream If you wish to time feed your kitty I suggest doing it 
around breakfast and dinner, two small meals and lots of play time. As 
Jackson here often says "Hunt, catch, kill". "Hunt & Catch" would be play 
time, kill would be their meal time. Then when he's done eating in the 
morning, put the bowl with his food away until dinner. Cats are what I call 
"dawn & Dusk" hunters, they rise to hunt with the sun and the same when the 
sunsets.
comments.author: WhiteKoneko

comments.text:
no problem. it's not too expensive, but it's not the cheapest either. it's 
worth it though
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text: Thanks for the help! I'll try to get my mom to buy that food.
comments.author: NintendodogsDream

comments.text:
my cat is overweight, and we feed him iams weight control. It works really 
well. Before we started feeding him that, he weighed 15 pounds at not even 
2 years old. now he's lost a bit of weight
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text: I didn't know this was bad, totally going to end free feeding!!﻿
comments.author: BiBi Palomino

comments.text:
Thank you Jackson for clarifying this I did free feed my 4 babies, now I 
feed 2-3 times a day!!!  AND i WENT GRAIN FREE AS MUCH AS i CAN AFFORD!﻿
comments.author: Renee Leokittygirl

comments.text:
I have a white cat that I saved from the neiborhood and she LOVES salmon so 
I give her wet food that is salmon and I give her half of the can so she 
basically gets a can and a half each day. I don't know if I'm doing this 
right but she is a bit under weight since there wasn't any cat food or meat 
in the wilderness but she is a very beautiful and nice cat. I don't know if 
she was owned and ran away or was being abused and got disowned by 
somebody. So can anybody help me to see if I'm feeding her correctly?﻿
comments.author: Emma Largen

comments.text:
I'm not an expert, but I think you should add more variety to her diet. 
Like give her other types of meat like chicken, beef etc. But don't take my 
word for it, cause like I said, I'm not an expert.
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text:
I leave food out for my cat all the time. She likes it when I'm in the 
kitchen with her when she eats, but will go by herself if she's hungry. 
She'll meow, look at me, and lead me to the kitchen. She doesn't eat too 
much at a time, and still appreciates the wet food I replace it with on 
certain days.﻿
comments.author: 1234Molotov

comments.text:
Question about grieving cats.  How do you help them cope with sudden death 
of a sibling?  Mine were like twins - did everything together - played, 
slept, ate, even drank water together.  I've taken in another cat but the 
older one just seems a bit resistent to bonding, even after two years.  Any 
advice?﻿
comments.author: Kel Nichols

comments.text:
Love this site and the show.  Very helpful.  In terms of litterbox help, I 
took in a homeless kitten and actually started him off in a tiny litterbox 
filled with clean dirt (figured that was his "comfort/familiar 
environment").   As the weeks progressed, I mixed it with unscented 
litter.  Worked great!﻿
comments.author: Kel Nichols

comments.text:
I have a cat but he has to live with a relative because my apartment 
landlord doesn't allow pets. He is an older cat and he is free fed like the 
other ones he has to live with. But he isn't overweight at all. In fact, he 
just seems to just get skinnier. But there are 3 females that he lives with 
among a few others and they are extremely fat. They are free fed 
considering that my relative works nearly every day of the week and is 
barely home. She tries to get in playtime with them before she goes. But if 
they weren't free fed, then their feeding times would be more like over 12 
hours apart and then they would be raiding the trash and stuff all the 
time. Though those fat girls sure could go without the food for a little 
while, or need to be on a diet to lose that weight. My relative also has 
another cat that might be part Bengal and she is active and eats a lot when 
she does eat and she just burns the calories almost as soon as she eats.﻿
comments.author: dondena21

comments.text:
Im really worried about my cat she's a year old her birthday is November 
8th 2013 I think, we have two other cats a boy and another girl we give 
them food in the same dish but sometimes I have to give My two girl cats 
food on my bed cause the boy cat kicks them away from the dish my cat 
autumn. Only eats a few bits then she done then shell leave it and are boy 
cat comes up and steals it she eats from the bowl but she uses her paw to 
take out her food and then eats it really only like three peaces or more 
then the boy cat kicks her from the dish I try to move them to other rooms 
but hell meow and then she wont eat but when I give her a treat or wet food 
she eats it like she's starving im so worried about her she is a totorshell 
mixed with a tabby I just am so worried about her she so skinny while my 
other ones are so fat:'( please help!!!!﻿
comments.author: Nyola McCabe

comments.text:
At the very least they should have separate dishes put her dish across from 
the boy cat. Or feed him first, cats are not like dogs in that they will 
continue to eat until they throw up. So once he is full then put her down 
to eat in her own bowl. This could be a territorial thing and I always fed 
my two cats out of their own bowls.
comments.author: Nicole P.

comments.text:
+Nicole P. I tried they won't eat unless the other one is in the same 
roomlol
comments.author: Nyola McCabe

comments.text:
+Nyola McCabe I'm going to go out on a limb here and suggest that you 
separate them when feeding so that each cat has their own dish and does not 
bully the others.
comments.author: Nicole P.

comments.text:
+mackenzie breaux minx and autumn been together for two years now I think 
and simba and them have been together for a few months going on to a year
comments.author: Nyola McCabe

comments.text: How long have you had them together?
comments.author: mackenzie breaux

comments.text:
I don't leave it in all day in her bowl but my dogs bowls yes she knows its 
food time when she sees or hears the food going in her bowl﻿
comments.author: Mia Brooks

comments.text:
my cat is on free feeding, shes about 8 y old, but she has no problems at 
all! she behaves way better than any other cat, and likes playing with us 
but she doesnt take her nails out and i think its not to harm us when 
playing. She also likes bitting us but doesnt apply any kind of force to 
the jaw. Shes the best cat in the world!!!﻿
comments.author: zilot

comments.text:
i have a cat, he is 9 years old i gave him free feeding from he was 5-6 
months, untill now, he is the most nice cat i have meet, i watch a lot of 
cat videos even from your program on tlc., and they are mean or kind of not 
intelligent, but funny, he is very intelligent, he is always in the same 
room where i am, he is a house cat, so he does not go out alone. he never 
had been mean or weird, he pee and poo in the box , but when he was younger 
he pee everywhere when i started to live with my boyfriend so i chose to 
take him to the vet, for a castration, and then he was pee in the box 
again, he sleeps in my bed, always in the same places, on the end or near 
my legs, i gave him treats friday saturday or saturday sunday, not every 
day, he can stay home alone for 2 days almost 3 days, he has food and a 
water fountain , but when i am at home he drinks water from the bathtub, i 
am glad he never got sick, i chose to  have him as a house cat because one 
time he jumped from the window i couldn't found him when i found him the 
next day, he had a scar, and the vet gave me medicine for him to give him 
for some days to prevent an infection, i was very sad, the food is very 
expensive here, i buy a more economical food, i am happy he is ok with that 
if i had more money i could buy better food with more meet, the vet told me 
the first time that the best is dry food instead of sweet food. i chose to 
give him free feeding because is to much stress, i hear people i must go 
home to feed my cat, or the cat is crying, what if i go out and i die or 
something happen, so i live him with food, water, toys, and all the space 
in my apartment, the balcony has also closed windows, because i live on the 
4th floor. his weight is 6 kg, he has the same weight for some years,file 
them, i use some kind of cream for animals for his paws, so they are not 
dry, and here in sweden the aire is very dry  i washhim once a month with 
cat shampoo and balm, .here in Sweden they don´t beleive in washing a cat, 
they think cats wash them selfs when i lived in Bolivia i washed all my 
pets, cats and dogs.i cut his nails, brush him, clean his ears and  i love 
him as a son, i wish i learned from your program, from the beginning, if i 
did something wrong, I have asperger and ocd middle level. should i change 
something now? or it is ok to continue this way? because it was never a 
problem. ﻿

No, thats not correct.. giving them wet cat food is a lot better than dry -

comments.text:
How you get your adult cat to stop meowing for food when he shouldn't have

comments.author: Hinata8710

comments.text:
My mother's cat (whom she would free-feed) was so naughty and not playful, 
she would rarely meow even though her breed is very vocal (she is a 
Siamese), and she was extremely jealous of new people who would interact 
with my mom or sister. My mom got tired of her and sent her to live with 
me. I do not free feed and after a few months she's a completely changed 
kitty. She's playful, she responds to authority better, and she's really 
friendly to new people. She also recently started chirping and meowing!!!! 
:) ﻿
comments.author: kittypuompuom

comments.text:
My cats don't have any bad habits. at all. They always have enough food in 
their bowl for 3 days, when they get to the bottom, even if there is a 
bunch on the sides, they try to conserve it it seems. Always been the best 
way for me as I have bad memory and every 6hours is too often for me to be 
honnest. ﻿
comments.author: malmapunkrock

comments.text:
I have always free fed my cat and If her bowl is ever empty she will stare 
at me while sit-standing at her bowl for a refill. She doesn't have any 
weight issues and she's an indoor/outdoor cat. When she wants to go outside 
she heads to whichever door leads outside and meows at me to let her out.﻿
comments.author: lazytobi24

comments.text:

logical to wait for the cats to ask for food instead of leaving it on the 
bow to waste (not to mention some cats only eat fresh anyway), but now I 
have proof to rub on my friends' faces every time they look me strange when 
I say I don't free feed my cats. Seriously, one of them acused me of 
starving my cats ¬¬ Anyway, thanks again! =^^=﻿

Other thing is that i play with her once i get off work 9pm-10pm and i fall

comments.author: Andrea “dearojas” Rojas

comments.text:
When the cat attacks, don't let him, stop giving it attention. IF you see 
other people do it, tell them to stop. Don't encourage it to do that.. Get 
a stick and a string with a toy hanging to play with your cat, take a 
little bit of time out of your day and play with your cat for him to get 
tired out, even panting a little bit. Than feed him or give it treats. You 
just have a young healthy cat that needs some play time with it's mommy and 
hand playing is really bad.

If I haven't already put food in my cats dish he will tell me to. Also, I

he comes right to the door and welcomes me home like a dog does. He even 
comes when I call him.﻿

I adopted a poor can from an animal chelter she wont interact whith me at

comments.author: dontkillmy vibee

comments.text:
I still didn't kwon this but I've never left free food. I always give her 
food two or three times at day ^^ Thanks Jackson I love your tips. Because 
of your tips I started to get toys for my little Missy :D﻿
comments.author: Odhyl Laure

comments.text:
My cat is perfect. No behavioral or health problems. He worships me and I 
worship him. I free feed dry food, but when I see that he's going to his 
food bowl, I bring out a dish of wet food. I would prefer to give him just 
wet food but he likes the dry food and I don't want to leave wet food out 
to get gross. So the dry food is just for the times when he's hungry and 
I'm not home to give him wet food. He doesn't like eating very much at 
once. He'll eat about half of the wet food and then rest for 30 minutes 
then eat half of what's left and so on. Unless you have behavioral or 
weight concerns, I don't think it's 100% necessary to do scheduled feeding. 
What you're feeding is far more important than when. I use Blue Wilderness 
dry and canned food. It's real meat (no byproducts), grain free, and high 
protein. There's also a real meat cat food that has to stay refrigerated 
even before opening. I can't remember what it's called but my cat loves it 
and it actually smells really delicious. ﻿
comments.author: JustAHorrorShow

comments.text:
+Marsha Stein that's bullshit. Some cats would lose their teeth, but then 
again, some cats will lose teeth regardless. wet food is more like their 
natural diet than dry, plus it is usually 70 percent water, so it's good 
for hydration as well.
comments.author: Clete Kass

comments.text:
I had a vet that told me years ago to avoid wet food, it's alright if only 
given once or twice a month. He said the wet food weakens the teeth so they 
have a tendency to lose their teeth early. My oldest is 15 and hasn't lost 
any of her teeth.
comments.author: Marsha Stein

comments.text:
My cat is perfect, just like yours. I also feed her Blue food products and 
dry is always there but I feed canned when I notice she's hungry. She 
doesn't have a weight issue. My hubby and I travel a lot and we can leave 
her for a week with just dry food, which is really convenient. I'm glad to 
hear that there are others with amazing cats. Have a great 2015.
comments.author: VStover Smiles

comments.text: I love your show. Cat that constently licks is this stress?﻿
comments.author: Hazel Burgess

comments.text:
My cats do a feeding time share. Since I work till really late, I feed them 
in the morning, then at late night. My cats will take turns eating because 
they don't like to be around each other some times. (other times, they will 
share a bowl and eat at the same time if they are hungry.) My cats are 
really healthy and fit too. I've gotten compliments saying I have cats with 
muscles and freaking man strength and that my cats are not fatties like 
some people's are. My cats also are great at playing by themselves, or with 
each other. So I know they are getting good exercise and are happy. ﻿

my cats are the same way, they won't eat at the same time, even though I

comments.author: Lilas Saleh

comments.text:
Ever since I saw this video, I've broken up my cat's meal times so that she 
gets fed smaller meals 4 times a day (or 3, depending on what hours I'm 
home) It's really helped with her weight! And most of the time she doesn't 
get stressed out about not having food in her bowl anymore. Sometimes she 
still does, and then I have to remember that I'm not being mean just 
because there's no food right now! ;) I also keep in mind what you said 
about going without food 5-6 hours, that also helped me release some guilt 
when she gets nervous about an empty bowl. Thank you for the video.﻿
comments.author: redhausliving

comments.text: sadly, my dog eats catfood﻿
comments.author: Christian Raleigh

comments.text:
I want to know why Felix is vomiting everything he eats (as far as I've 
noticed at least.). I do think the free feeding might be part of the 
problem (I also know never to get whiskers wet food again, least in those 
little packets).

I would say that the dry food is the problem, but he does this to every 
kind of food we give him, to my knowledge. As for Lucy, our other 
cat...she's just picky. definitely prefers wet food (but not tuna).﻿
comments.author: Gaming_with_Katt

comments.text:

mushy stools as well that he produces when he defecates? If so then you may 
have to go with a higher quality can food and get rid of the dry 
completely. No grains, but pumpkin and greens are good.
comments.author: Nicole P.

comments.text:
To be honnest, your cat food's first ingredient should be chicken, or beef,

comments.author: malmapunkrock

comments.text:
+Claire Lena
wow, thanks for the helps, guys
comments.author: Gaming_with_Katt

comments.text:
My cat vomited every time after eating dried food. I figured it was because 
the dried stuff expands in their stomach, and he just couldn't tolerate it. 
We tried almost every kind available, but to no avail. However! After 
trying literally 99% of cat kibble, even the kibble designed for sensitive 
stomachs, we found one he could tolerate. It's called Go Cat for indoor 
cats (even though he's not an indoor cat) and he hasn't vomited since. I 
don't know what's different about it, but it works! I live with my mum who 
has two cats of her own, and they only eat dried food (I feed mine wet 
food), which is why I had to find a safe one for my cat in case he sneaked 
some of theirs, which he does a lot. :)
comments.author: Claire Lena

comments.text: +Sara Purser Thx, I'll give it a try when I can :)
comments.author: Gaming_with_Katt

comments.text:
We used to have that problem with one of my cats and we found two causes of 
it. 

The first was that she needed to be switched to sensitive stomach food (per 
the vet's recommendation) and that helped most of the problem. And the 
other problem I found online. Some website said that sometimes cats will 
eat too fast which will cause them to throw up. It said to put their food 
spread out on a shallow dish or I just make sure her food is on a single 
layer (dry food) so she can't take in as much at once. Doing both of those 
made her stop. The only time it ever happens now is if she sneaks a bunch 
of her sisters food (who is on special diabetic food).

I would recommend the food bowl set up though. Just an idea. Hope it helps! 
I know cleaning up vomit is no fun!
comments.author: Sara Purser

comments.text:
Not all cats like meat, some like veggies to!! I try to give her some 
veggie, it works sometimes ^D^ (And CATS can also eat dog food sometimes, 
well some.)﻿

comments.text: Fluff = Cat + Mine = My Fluff Cat

comments.author: sean minnaar

comments.text:
One thing I havr noticed is there are so many people who only feed their 
cats once a day look at me like Ive lost it when I say they need feeding 3x 
a day. but I put a full tin down and don'y eat it all they are not going to 
would you eat food thats been sat on the floor for hours. They are unlikely 
to go back to it the reason your vats skinny is your feeding them 
wrong.fresh food 3x a day and you will have less wasteage. We went onto 
pouches onr pouch per cat at each meal time. Saved a fortune little or no 
waste than we had with tins.﻿
comments.author: Carl Wilson

comments.text: I love my fat kitty. The all-day buffet stays!﻿
comments.author: Harpo Django Rose

comments.text: My kitty will meow at me repeatedly if she doesn't have food 24/7﻿
comments.author: Andrew Miller

comments.text:
I feed my cat twice a day. I give him a small amount in the morning before 
I go to work. And then when I come home his bowl is empty and he gets a 
small amount for dinner. I don't free feed. And he seems to not even care 
about left out food, get that nasty stale crap out of my bowl. lol﻿
comments.author: Ed Bunny

comments.text:
Why is free feeding not ideal for cats? Because they eat only FRESH food? I 
noticed that our cats don't eat things that was too much time on their 
"plate". But ok, they are good hunters, maybe it's cause of that...﻿
comments.author: brezzainvernale

comments.text:
I agree with you, I figured that out on my own years ago. And besides, 
leaving food around like that attracts bugs and those little unwanted furry 
things, mice, and I don't want either of those in my home. And no, not all 
cats are mice catchers. My friend had a male cat that would look at the 
mouse running around in his kitchen, and turn over and go back to sleep as 
if he were saying, I'm not bothering that mouse because that mouse is not 
bothering me yawn lol. All of the cats I've had in life were excellent 
mouse catchers, some even were bird catchers. Aww, but hey, they're cats, 
and that's natural to most of them.﻿
comments.author: Ebony_Love_R_007

comments.text:
The one thing he missed on this is that you shouldn't give treats to a cat. 
You can of course give treat "meals" to your cat. Like maybe a salmon steak 
from time to time, but cats shouldn't be trained to take food from people's 
hands ever. I won't go into why that is a bad idea, but I think you can 
summarize why that's not cool to do. ﻿
comments.author: 400KrispyKremes

comments.text:
+Kelly Horvat I guess that makes sense. I give my cat treats too, but only 
in his bowl. He likes salmon a lot.
comments.author: 400KrispyKremes

comments.text:
Small comment on this.. Didn't Jackson in one of his shows actually feed a 
treat to a cat under the bed with his hand, and that shows trust and 
bonding? What stranger actually feeds random crap to a cat anyway? My cat 
will only have a treat from my hand because he knows it's safe. MY hand.
comments.author: Kelly Horvat

comments.text: +canuck21 That was very insightful.

comments.text: +400KrispyKremes Wow, you are not normal.
comments.author: canuck21

comments.text:
How is asking for proof when someone is making a claim "trolling"? Not even 
close.
Its something that anyone who uses their brain and has an interest in the 
topic would do. Simply asking for where someone got their "facts" from isnt 
trolling. End of story. Its a sad state the world is in when mindlessly 
believing anything you read is considered preferable to truth and knowledge.
But that last comment did solidify it for me. You really do seem like an 
overly sensitive, irrational human being. I wouldnt go so far as saying "I 
hate you" more so I just have sympathy for being so small minded.
comments.author: Nevyn Noir

comments.text:
+Nevyn Noir Oh okay I get it now, You hate me. You weren't really asking me 
that question honestly, you were just trying to be mean.
If I get the time I will do the research, so that the next time I write a 
comment about this I will be able to cite sources.
Have a nice day troll lady. It has not been a pleasure.
comments.author: 400KrispyKremes

comments.text:
That logic seems pretty illogical. If you never give treats to your cat and 
IF your cat happens to even go outside in the first place, the cat would 
probably be MORE likely to take a treat from a stanger once they smell the 
treat...because its such a rare thing and they never get treats.

Let me guess, you have no actual, respected, researched evidence supporting 
what you are saying?
comments.author: Nevyn Noir

comments.text:
+Nevyn Noir Okay then, the reason to not do that is because it will make 
them more likely to take treats from strangers, and while it is only a 
minor problem for them to over-eat, it can be a much more severe problem if 
the neighborhood bully/psycho kid lures your cat with the promise of a nice 
treat because he wants to do unspeakable things to it.
comments.author: 400KrispyKremes

comments.text:
what are you talking about? Saying that, then saying "I won't go into why 
that is a bad idea" is completely unhelpful.
comments.author: Nevyn Noir
